commit.message: GG-27999 Handling primary node left for transaction with syncMode != FULL_SYNC

nodes.bodyText: What's the point in testing full sync mode with zero backups ?

TestRecordingCommunicationSpi  is not used in clean way.
Check for usage examples of methods blockMessage and waitForBlocked in the code base.
You even don't need the SpecialSpi class.

These class fields look useless.
Better to fetch spi when it's needed using org.apache.ignite.internal.TestRecordingCommunicationSpi#spi(ignite)

Doesn't look good to me. The transaction can still be in prepared state and recovering for other primaries.
I think it's ok to trigger heuristic exception only if near tx is in commiting state and a primary node has failed. No need to check for backups therefore.

commit.message: GG-27999 fix after run all on teamcity

nodes.bodyText:
You should print informative partition loss message here, like here:
org.apache.ignite.internal.processors.cache.distributed.dht.GridDhtTopologyFutureAdapter#validateKey.
new CacheInvalidStateException("Failed to commit a transaction (all partition owners have left the grid, partition data has been lost) [cacheName=cache, partition=10, key=somekey]")
I think better to avoid heuristic exception and use CacheException instread.
We don't need an empty line here
We can use @RunWith(Parameterized.class) instead for testing with various values of this parameter.
It's better to preset DataRegionConfiguration#maxSize to reasonable value (e.g. 100 mb). By default, Ignite node allocates 20% of physical memory, which sometimes causes OOMs on TC.
Please add description for parameter and exception class. IDEA highlights absence of a comment as a warning. Applicable to several more places in the test class.

Let's use cleanPersistenceDir();
Attempt to clean the whole work dir may fail locally (e.g. if I have a log file opened).
If it's possible, extract message in TX code as a public static final constant use reuse it in this test. If someone has to change the message, this test will fail.

Weird code, must be:
Optional.of(tx.transactionNodes().getOrDefault(nodeId, Collections.emptySet())).orElse(Collections.emptySet()).stream()) -> tx.transactionNodes().getOrDefault(nodeId, emptySet()).stream()
Never forget about static imports codestyle rule.
